text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so today 
I'm going to make salad rolls or in Thai cilantro

now when you hear salad rolls you might be like 
oh yeah I know all about south roll is nothing new

here but let me tell you these are special they're 
special in two ways one they're super cute and two

the dipping sauce is nothing like I've ever seen 
before these are now becoming really popular in

Thailand my mom kept buying them when I was in 
Thailand recently and it's a creamy spicy garlicky

dip that is so good and so different and I really 
needed to share it with you so let's get started

so I'm going to start with the dipping sauce which 
when I first had it I was really kind of shocked

because it tasted like a creamy and slightly 
sweet version of the seafood dipping sauce which

we all know I am obsessed with I put that thing on 
everything it's super super easy when I start with

some garlic which I'm adding with the skin on 
so that I can give it a quick smash and then it

peels a lot more easily and then I'm going to add 
my chili so this is a spicy sauce and you can add

as much or as little as you want and I'm adding 
red chillies but if you want it to have sort of a

tinge of green and said you can do green chillies 
as well we get these ground up really finely okay

so most of it is pretty fine but you notice if 
those big chunks of chili skin which is always

there and most of the time it doesn't matter but 
for this I really wanted to be fine so what I'm

going to do is I'm going to add some salt and the 
salt is going to help sort of become an abrasive

and help break down all of its skin I am using 
salt instead of fish sauce for this recipe I know

crazy no fish sauce but it's because if I use fish 
sauce which I did try before the dip becomes a

little bit too runny and it doesn't stick as well 
so I'm using salt instead tada all right so see

how it's all mashed in this spicy garlicky mess 
that's perfect the next ingredient is what's going

to give it creaminess and that is some mayonnaise 
so I'm using real mayonnaise for this make sure

you use good quality mayonnaise no light no fat 
free you know none of that weird fake mayonnaise

stuff and for sweetness this is something a little 
different I am going to add condensed milk that's

right sweetened condensed milk for a couple 
of reasons one if I asked sugar it actually

dissolved and it becomes a little bit runny too 
this adds such great creaminess and no it's not

your Heath weird it's not going to taste like 
it's half desert half savory it's just going to

be sweet thick and creamy and delicious and I got 
this idea because I know that in Thailand a lot of

times what they do is they use a creamy salad 
dressing and then mix it with you know garlic

and chilies and all that stuff and in the Thai 
creamy salad dressing is the condensed milk so

it's not like I'm making this up out of nowhere so 
now we've got sweet we've got salty sour of course

lime juice fresh lime juice only and that's it 
and now I think is the perfect time for the mini

risk aha mmm just look at that now at this point 
you want to taste it you can add a little more

salt you can add more sweetness more lime juice 
whatever you want and also if your ingredients

are all at room temperature like mine it will be 
a little runny ones you stick this in the fridge

with the condensed milk in the Mayo it's going 
to get a little bit thicker all right so now the

size of rose so what I love love these salad rolls 
is they are cute little bite sized and they don't

have any noodles or any carbs inside the rolls 
themselves which make them you know a little

healthier than the ones that sort of filled with 
noodles you know you can be really creative with

what vegetables you choose but here are sort of 
the base ones that I'm going to suggest okay and

then I'll put a whole list of other suggestions 
in the written recipe but the main thing that

you absolutely need is some salad green so what I 
have is some spring mix you know you know the box

spring makes you use for green and whatnot but 
I would choose one with really cool interesting

leaves you know something would like to shape like 
this with red leaves round leaves when you put it

together to be really pretty I've also got some 
arugula over here which has an interesting shape

and also gives you that peppery bitter flavor for 
those of you who enjoy such flavours in terms of

harder crunchy err vegetables of course you have 
to have carrots and these carrots I just shredded

using a julienne peeler like this cucumber I took 
out the seeds of the cucumber because the seeds I

find makes it a little too wet I've got some 
bell peppers and some cilantro you don't have

to use cilantro you don't have to use any herbs 
at all and then protein no you don't have to add

the protein but I find it does help both flavor 
and texture to have something in there and I love

using ham this is the type that my mom used to 
buy a lot is the ham one I've also got a simple

tuna salad so there's just tuna and mayo and black 
pepper simple tuna salad this is another variety

of my mom love if you are vegetarian you want 
to make this vegetarian what I like to use also

is marinated tofu so this is pressed tofu the 
same kind of useful Pad Thai and I just let it

marinate instead of dilute solution of soy sauce 
sweet soy sauce and water output instructions in

the written recipe but you can really marinate 
it with anything you want now the paper we are

going to wrap these salad rolls with the classic 
Vietnamese sort of fresh spring roll rice paper

which is actually made from tapioca and or rice 
flour believe it or not this is an 8 inch mere

roughly 8 inch sheet I only want half of it per 
roll so I'm going to actually use my scissors now

bigger scissors will actually be better and less 
awkward but this is the only one we have right now

and if it shatters and breaks a little bit around 
the edges don't worry about it you won't be able

to see it and I turn around and cut from this side 
just because it's easier see if you have bigger

scissors you don't have to turn this whole thing 
around there you go and I lost a little piece here

no big deal once you roll it up you won't see it 
so I'm just going to cut a few more of these as

per usual we're going to dip this brave paper in 
some water so I've got here some pretty warm water

and it only takes ten seconds take it out and 
it's going to feel too stiff but once you let

it sit on your board it will continue to absorb 
all the water that's around it and it will soften

now I know it looks like how are you going to wrap 
anything with a semicircle piece of grass ha we're

going to fix that so I'm going to fold in about an 
inch from the edge into the middle I'm going to go

to the salad and what I want to do is pick maybe 
three to four leaves stickin arugula in there

and you know choose things that are different 
shapes or they're pre I'm going to come down

here and lay it down so that the leaves are just 
sticking off the top so I need the same thing on

the other side now I've got my four pretty 
leaves I'm going to stick it down right here

look how cute these are so now we have to cut 
these in half because each one is actually to

bite so I'm going to cut one right in the middle 
so you want to really sharp knife and with the

slicing motion rather than the pushing down 
motion tada and then the inside is beautiful

and then you can serve them either late down or 
standing up like that look at this lush garden

of salad rolls I can't wait and these are so 
easy to eat there's easily served at a party

and everyone just takes one I'm going to go with 
the ham one oh yes see how the consistency of

the dip is just perfect holds on and that is 
my favorite way to eat salad seriously that

dipping sauce is so good I've actually used it 
as a salad dressing to thin it out a little bit

with them olive oil or something it's garlicky 
it's spicy and card from the lime juice yeah

just creamy and sweet I mean is so good and the 
salad rolls themself have so much texture going

on the carrots are crunchy and then you bite into 
like fresh vegetables and then that salty ham oh

my god like you you seriously have tried if you 
like salad rose this is salad rolls on steroids

it is so good so I hope you give it a try the 
recipe will be on hot hsn.com when you make it

send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram 
and if you haven't subscribed to the show you can

so right here so you never miss an episode and I 
will see you next time for your next edition hi
